snippet: The high court on Friday rejected an appeal by Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani against contempt charges, escalating a tense standoff between the judiciary and the ruling party.
abstract: Pakistan's Supreme Court dismisses an appeal over contempt charges against Prime Min Yousaf Raza Gilani for failing to pursue corruption investigations of Pres Asif Ali Zardari, escalating a tense standoff between the judiciary and the governing Pakistan Peoples Party.
lead_paragraph: The high court on Friday rejected an appeal by Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani against contempt charges, escalating a tense standoff between the judiciary and the ruling party.

headline.seo: Pakistan Supreme Court Rejects Yousaf Raza Gilani’s Appeal
headline.main: Rejecting Appeal, Pakistani Court Says Premier Must Face Charges
headline.print_headline: Rejecting Appeal, Pakistani Court Says Premier Must Face Charges
